net.fathomsoft.nova.tree

Class ProgramNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.TreeNode
      • net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.ProgramNode

  • public class ProgramNode
extends TreeNode
    TreeNode extension that represents a whole Nova program. The purpose of this Node is to keep track of each FileNode within a compiled program and contain methods to manipulate the FileNodes.
    Since:
    v0.2 Apr 14, 2014 at 11:52:33 PM
    Version:
    v0.2.13 Jun 17, 2014 at 8:45:35 AM
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public void addChild(TreeNode child)
        Override addChild(TreeNode) method to make it synchronized. Needs to be synchronized so that the threads dont try to write their file nodes to the ProgramNode at the same time and end up creating empty spaces in the tree.
        Overrides:
        addChild in class TreeNode
        Parameters:
        child - The node to set as the child node.
        See Also:
        TreeNode.addChild(net.fathomsoft.nova.tree.TreeNode)

      • getController

        public Nova getController()
        Get the compiler's controller. The controller is used for logging, error output, and other compiler options.
        Overrides:
        getController in class TreeNode
        Returns:
        The compiler's controller instance.

      • getClassNode

        public ClassNode getClassNode(java.lang.String className)
        Get the ProgramNode's ClassNode with the specified name.

        For example: 
         public class Person
 {
        
        ...
        
 }

        A call like: "getClass("Person")" would return the ClassNode for the "Person" class.
        Parameters:
        className - The name of the class to search for.
        Returns:
        The ClassNode for the class, if it exists.

      • getFile

        public FileNode getFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Get the ProgramNode's FileNode with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file to search for.
        Returns:
        The FileNode for the file, if it exists.
